greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{d|n} d^(1 + 2*n/d).
comment: If p is prime, a(p) = 1 + p^3. - _Robert Israel_, Nov 03 2017
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..3143
formula: L.g.f.: -log(Product_{k>=1} (1 - k^2*x^k)) = Sum_{n>=1} a(n)*x^n/n. - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Mar 12 2018
mathematica: sd[n_] := Module[{d = Divisors[n]}, Total[d^(1 + (2 n)/d)]]; Array[sd,40] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Mar 17 2020 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = sumdiv(n, d, d^(1+2*n/d)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Nov 02 2017
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Nov 02 2017
